page.title: 12MORRIS DANCING
page.content: Mossley and Stalybridge annual Wakes holiday period covers the last two weeks of July and serves as a reminder of the years when all Industry closed down and the population disappeared to the seaside. With the present unemployment situation (over 20 percent) and the loss of traditional industries in the area, Mossley Wakes is not what it was. There is still the Wakes Fair on the Market Ground and the Annual tour of the area by the Saddleworth and Mossley Morrismen. Morris Dancing has, over the last few years, had something of a revival with new groups being formed almost annually. The interest has extended into the schools with Micklehurst Junior School having a well-established boys dancing team.
